main event: On 19 August 1957, a witness reported observing a bright object in the sky for approximately 2-3 seconds in Fairborn, Ohio.
interesting points: The object was described as similar to burning magnesium and produced a smoke trail., The course of the object was northbound and it disappeared behind a tree., The sighting had both physical evidence and a conclusion suggesting it was an astro event (meteor)., The observation was confirmed by a civilian source., The report was submitted to Project Blue Book for further investigation.
sighted object: a bright object with a smoke trail
